meanings.definition: Unable to be passed or crossed
meanings.sent1: The mountain was impassible, blocking our path completely.
meanings.sent2: The river was impassible due to the strong current.
meanings.sent3: The maze was designed to be impassible, but we found a secret passage!
meanings.sent4: Her stoic expression made her seem impassible to any emotional turmoil.
meanings.sent5: The fortress was built with an impassible wall, deterring any invaders.

meanings.definition: Incapable of feeling pain or suffering
meanings.sent1: The robot's metal body was impassible to any physical harm.
meanings.sent2: The superhero seemed almost impassible to the villain's attacks.
meanings.sent3: The cat acted impassible when the vacuum cleaner scared it, but we knew it was just pretending.
meanings.sent4: His calm demeanor in the face of chaos made him appear impassible to stress.
meanings.sent5: The ancient statue's face looked impassible, as if frozen in time.
